recipeDescriptionLines.recipeDescriptionLine: Unniyappam is a famous sweet in Kerala. It is also widely eaten like a snack. May it be any festival, Unniyappam is always find its place among other dishes.

The sweetness comes from Jaggery and banana is used as another main ingredient. It is a crispy from outside and moist from inside. Rice flour gives the crispiness to the dish but wheat flour can be used as a substitute.
However, only Unniyappam pan can be used to make this dish.

procedureSteps.stepDescription: In a pan / wok, dry roast rice flour for 5-7 mins on medium flame. This is done to remove the raw smell. Allow it to cool.

Powder the jaggery and add water. Heat it on a medium flame, till jaggery is melted. Switch off the stove and allow it to sit from 5 mins. Strain and keep it aside. This will remove any residual or waste from jaggery. Let it cool down.
Take 2 tsp of ghee and roast dry coconut for 2-3 mins. Meanwhile, cut banana in small pieces.
In a mixing bowl, add banana and melted jaggery to the rice flour. Mix it well. Banana should be mashed completely. Use hand mixer to save time.
Add dry coconut, cardamom powder, sesame seeds and remaining 2 tsp of ghee. Keep the batter aside for an hour. Mix it well. If the batter is too thick , add milk. Mix it well.

For making Unniyappam, make sure the pan is hot. Pour oil in each cup of the pan. When the oil gets hot, using a spoon, pour the batter into each cup and reduce the flame. Using a fork, check if it has turned golden brown on one side. Once done, flip it carefully using a fork. Once it turns golden brown on each side, remove it from the pan and keep it on the paper towel to remove excess oil. Repeat the process for the remaining batter.

tips.tipDesc: Thickness of batter can be identified depending on how nicely it drops from your hand or spoon. take the batter in a spoon and try dropping off.  It it takes more than a second, it means batter is too thick. Add milk slowly as you don't want the batter to be running.
For authentic recipe, coconut oil is used for frying. But, you can always replace with vegetable oil.
